levelledPara.title: General
levelledPara.para: The following amplified emergency procedure elaborate upon information contained in the Emergency Procedures checklist portion of this section.

levelledPara.title: Engine Failure
levelledPara.para: If engine failure occur during take-off roll, the most important to do is stop the airplane on the remaining runway. If engine failure during flight, perform air start. If air start failed, landing as soon as possible. Landing should be planned straight ahead with only small changes in direction to avoid obstruction.

Engine failures during flight, there are 3 condition:
Aircraft is able to reach runway and pilot have aircraft control: Pilot must maintain wing level, set throttle and land the aircraft immediately.
Aircraft is not able to reach runway but pilot have aircraft control: Pilot must guide direct the aircraft heading at unpopulated area and land the aircraft at hard surface.
Aircraft is not able to reach runway and pilot is not able to take control:
The aircraft will terminate flight because there is no power to continue flight. The only action that can be done is monitor aircraft location from GCS monitor and shut down engine.
Condition 1 and 2 can be performed if pilot have a good visibility to the aircraft.
If Conditon 3 occurs, GCS operator shall perform the emergency task in coordination with pilot and mission commander

levelledPara.title: Electrical Power Supply System Malfunction
levelledPara.para: Electrical power malfunction can be detected and monitored at GCS by voltage indicator.

By monitoring voltage indicator during operation, electric power malfunction can be detected earlier. Landing the aircraft as soon as possible if indicator at GCS detected malfunction of electrical power and check battery voltage before flight
